pullRequest.body:
In this PR, given a morphism `f : A ⟶ B` in the category `CommRingCat`, and `M : ModuleCat B`, we define the type `M.Derivation f` of derivations with values in `M` relative to `f`. We also construct the module of differentials `CommRingCat.KaehlerDifferential f : ModuleCat B` and the corresponding derivation. (These are basically "bundled" versions of the unbundled constructions already in mathlib.)

---

This is extended to presheaves of modules in #14014.

Thanks @erdOne for the reviews. I could not make certain definitions global instances (because it would break other parts on mathlib), but by declaring them as a local instance in the main file, it works fine.

Thanks!

maintainer merge

```suggestion
lemma d_map (a : A) : D.d (f a) = 0 :=
  letI := f.toAlgebra
  letI := Module.compHom M f
  D.map_algebraMap a
```
This is just `IsScalarTower.of_algebraMap_eq'`
Thanks!

This holds in a much more general case
```lean
import Mathlib.Algebra.Group.Action.Defs

instance {R S M : Type*} [CommMonoid M] [SMul R M] [SMul S M]
    [IsScalarTower R M M] [IsScalarTower S M M] :
    SMulCommClass R S M where
  smul_comm r s x := by
    rw [← one_smul M (s • x), ← smul_assoc, ← one_smul M x, ← smul_assoc s 1 x,
      smul_comm, smul_assoc, one_smul, smul_assoc, one_smul]
```
Thanks!
There is `ModuleCat.ofHom`.
I do not think it applies here.
This can be an instance, and should go near `Module.compHom`.
I wonder whether it works if `[Algebra A B]` is given and `algebraMap A B` is used instead of `f`. Can lean see through `RingHom.toAlgebra`?
It does.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: differentials as an object in ModuleCat

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: relative differentials as a presheaf of modules
